uh we'll come to find out that there are
three types of fine-tuning data sets uh
that are most relevant uh for
customizing Foundation models the one
you might be the most familiar with uh
is the one on the left and that's called
instruction fine-tuning uh instruction
fine tuning fundamentally is about
bringing a prompt um or an inst
instruction both of those are strings
that you send to your model and you use
to get responses back in instruction
fine-tuning um essentially the core
reason you do instruction fine tuning is
because you want to teach your model how
to do something new um so if you want to
teacher model how to write in a specific
style or an do analysis in a particular
style how to do
summarization um how to extract entities
how to do translation um all of these of
core NLP tasks that you'd like to teach
your model to do uh instruction
fine-tuning is the core way to do that
the second type of fine tuning uh you
see here in the middle is called chat
fine-tuning uh chat fine-tuning really
is essentially a type of instruction
fine tuning but it's slightly different
um because what you want to do is give
your model the ability to have a
conversation uh which isn't quite the
same as just instruction fine tuning CU
in in that uh instruction fine tuning on
the left the result is the model will be
able to complete a task and so that's
sort of what an agent um or an entity
will be able to do um but chat
fine-tuning um gives it a flare and it
helps it understand human conversation
um such as just minor changes in
preferences in syntax um it helps the
model learn how to be conversational uh
and so chat fine tuning is a really
great way you can take any model that's
already been instruction fine tuned uh
so after you take your model out of the

essentially that's a common way to make

it will probably know those topics
reasonably well um but it won't know
about your business it won't know about
your data sets um because it didn't have
access to those while training and so
domain adaptation um is a way you can do
what's called contined pre-training
